title: Yoga (philosophy)
summary: Yoga philosophy is one of the six major orthodox schools of Hinduism.[1][2] Ancient, medieval and most modern literature often refers to Yoga-philosophy simply as Yoga,[1][3] and it is only at the end of the first millennium CE that Yoga is mentioned as a separate school of thought in Indian texts, distinct from Samkhya.[4][5][web 1] The systematic collection of ideas of Yoga-philosophy is found in the Yoga Sutras of Patanjali,[6][7] a key text of Yoga-philosophy[web 1] which has influenced all other schools of Indian philosophy.[8][9]
